content.definition: An inherited thrombophilia caused by a point mutation (G20210A) in the 3' untranslated region of the prothrombin (Factor II) gene, resulting in elevated plasma prothrombin levels and increased risk of venous thromboembolism. It is the second most common inherited thrombophilia after Factor V Leiden.

genetics.mutation: G20210A in 3' UTR of prothrombin gene
prevalence: Rare in Asian and African populations

when_to_test: Same indications as Factor V Leiden testing

management.duration: Based on provoked vs unprovoked, recurrence risk
prevention: Avoid additional risk factors when possible

No functional assay - must test genetically
Often co-inherited with FVL - additive risk
